      This Event+Procedure exhibits following behavior: On procedure execute() If had enough timeouts, abort the procedure.

      • testTimeoutEventProcedure

        public void testTimeoutEventProcedure()
                               throws Exception
        Tests being able to suspend a Procedure for N timeouts and then failing.s Resets the timeout after each elapses. See TestProcedureEvents.TestTimeoutEventProcedure for example of how to do this sort of trickery with the ProcedureExecutor; i.e. suspend for a while, check for a condition and if not set, suspend again, etc., ultimately failing or succeeding eventually.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • testTimeoutEventProcedureDoubleExecution

                                              throws Exception
